item.title: Word of the Day: resilience
item.description: This word has appeared in 1,286 articles on NYTimes.com in the past year. Can you use it in a sentence?
item.dc:creator: The Learning Network

item.title: ‘You Cannot Feel Remotely Sorry for the Patriots’: Opinion Writers Tackle the Super Bowl
item.description: Super Bowl LX is in the books. An Opinion round table breaks down the game, the entertainment — and the commercials.
item.dc:creator: Michelle Cottle, David French, Carlos Lozada and Stephen Stromberg

item.title: Death, Undocumented
item.description: A decade or so after the peak of Europe’s migrant crisis, one of the busiest and deadliest entry points to the continent has devolved from crisis to something more chronic.
item.dc:creator: Giuliano Beniamino Fleri
item.category: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis

item.title: ‘Love Story,’ Plus 6 Things to Watch on TV This Week
item.description: The Ryan Murphy series about John F. Kennedy Jr. and Carolyn Bessette premieres, and a new A24 non-scripted series airs.
item.dc:creator: Shivani Gonzalez

media:content.media:description: Sarah Pidgeon and Paul Kelly in “Love Story.”

item.title: Seahawks’ Defense Swamps the Patriots: Images From the Super Bowl
item.description: Sam Darnold’s steady Seattle offense controlled the game, but it was the defensive side that put another title out of reach for New England. Photographers followed the action.
item.dc:creator: The New York Times

media:content.media:description: The backbones of the world champion Seattle offense: quarterback Sam Darnold and running back Kenneth Walker III, the Super Bowl M.V.P., hoisting the Vince Lombardi Trophy.

item.title: ¿Qué significa el 64 que llevó Bad Bunny en su atuendo del Super Bowl?
item.description: ¿Y de dónde era su traje? Las respuestas pueden sorprender.
item.dc:creator: Jacob Gallagher

media:content.media:description: Bad Bunny lució un traje de Zara en su espectáculo del medio tiempo del Super Bowl.

item.title: Five Years After Myanmar Coup, ‘Even Hope Has Become a Risk’
item.description: The country’s cities have been spared the violence of a hard-fought civil war. But as the economy has hollowed out, many urbanites have become desperate.
item.dc:creator: Richard C. Paddock and Lauren DeCicca
item.category: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat

media:content.media:description: The downtown of Yangon, Myanmar’s largest city. Urban areas in the country have been plagued by issues like soaring inflation, high unemployment and shortages of goods.

item.title: Quote of the Day: For U.S. Athletes at Olympics, No Escaping American Politics
item.description: Quotation of the Day for Monday, February 9, 2026.

item.title: In Pakistan, a Kite Festival Returns to Troubled Skies
item.description: The vibrant celebration, banned for two decades, brightened the eastern city of Lahore, where residents face alarming levels of air pollution and political restrictions.
item.dc:creator: Elian Peltier, Zia ur-Rehman and Saiyna Bashir

media:content.media:credit: Saiyna Bashir for The New York Times

item.title: El niño en el show de Bad Bunny en el Super Bowl era un actor
item.description: En internet se especuló mucho sobre la identidad del niño. El joven actor publicó en las redes sociales su experiencia como parte del espectáculo de Bad Bunny.
item.dc:creator: Emmanuel Morgan

item.title: After M23 Takeover, Goma Carries Violent Memories and Signs of Hope
item.description: A year after a rebel takeover, residents of Goma, in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo, carry violent memories and signs of hope.
item.dc:creator: Guerchom Ndebo
item.category: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity

media:content.media:description: One year ago, M23, a rebel militia, violently charged into the city of Goma in the Democratic Republic of Congo and took it over from the government.

item.title: From Fishing Nets to Furniture: Turning Ocean Plastic Into Usable Products
item.description: A brother-and-sister team in Spain started a sustainable business model recycling old and damaged nets into stadium seating and decorations.
item.dc:creator: Lena Mucha For The New York Times

item.title: No Corrections: Feb. 9, 2026
item.description: No corrections appeared in print on Monday, Feb. 9, 2026.

item.title: Bad Bunny’s Super Bowl Halftime Show: Takeaways and Best Moments
item.description: Popcast’s immediate thoughts after Bad Bunny took the stage for a tribute to his native Puerto Rico.
item.dc:creator: Jon Caramanica, Joe Coscarelli, Sophie Erickson, Kate LoPresti, Andrew Smith, Chris Moore, Pat Gunther and Nick Pitman

media:content.media:credit: Photo Illustration by The New York Times; Kirby Lee/Imagn Images, via Reuters Connect

item.title: The Child in Bad Bunny’s Halftime Show Was an Actor
item.description: There was much speculation about the boy’s identity. The young actor posted on social media about his experience as part of Bad Bunny’s performance.
item.dc:creator: Emmanuel Morgan

item.title: Bad Bunny entrega una carta de amor a Puerto Rico en el Super Bowl
item.description: La actuación fue una explosión caleidoscópica de alegría y un escaparate de algunos de los aspectos más extáticos y festivos de la cultura latina.
item.dc:creator: Jon Pareles, Ben Sisario and Lindsay Zoladz

media:content.media:credit: Loren Elliott para The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Bad Bunny baila encima de un camión, rodeado de bailarines y un campo de caña de azúcar simulado.

item.title: What Was the ‘Ocasio 64’ Reference on Bad Bunny’s Super Bowl Look?
item.description: And where did his suit come from? The answers may surprise.
item.dc:creator: Jacob Gallagher

media:content.media:credit: Loren Elliott for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: The 64 printed on Bad Bunny’s outfit gave the internet something to talk about.

item.title: Bad Bunny invita a Lady Gaga, Ricky Martin y Cardi B a su celebración en el Super Bowl
item.description: La casita volvió a llenarse con una sorprendente mezcla de estrellas, que incluyó a Pedro Pascal, Jessica Alba, Karol G y Young Miko.
item.dc:creator: James Wagner and Annie Correal

media:content.media:credit: Loren Elliott para The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Lady Gaga interpretó una versión de “Die With a Smile”, su exitoso dueto con Bruno Mars.

item.title: El Super Bowl marca otra consagración para Bad Bunny
item.description: Presentarse en el Super Bowl es un momento muy importante para Bad Bunny, y que eso suceda tras el lanzamiento de ‘Debí tirar más fotos’, su álbum más personal, debe hacer que esa actuación sea aún más especial.
item.dc:creator: Joe Coscarelli and Jon Caramanica

media:content.media:credit: Dana Scruggs para The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Un año antes de su actuación en el show del medio tiempo del Super Bowl, Bad Bunny realizó una entrevista con Popcast.

item.title: Jimmy Lai’s 20-Year Term Follows a Familiar Chinese Pattern
item.description: The heavy sentence for the Hong Kong publisher aligns with mainland cases where influential critics of the Communist Party have been sent to prison for many years.
item.dc:creator: Lily Kuo
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

item.title: Bad Bunny Delivers a Love Letter to Puerto Rico at Super Bowl Halftime
item.description: His performance featured a sugar cane field, a wedding seemingly officiated onstage and a New York-style street scene, along with appearances by Lady Gaga and Ricky Martin.
item.dc:creator: Jon Pareles, Ben Sisario and Lindsay Zoladz

media:content.media:credit: Loren Elliott for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Bad Bunny’s halftime set featured a replica of a sugar-cane field and scores of backup dancers.

item.title: Turning Point USA’s Halftime Show Pays Tribute to Charlie Kirk
item.description: Kid Rock was the headliner at the streamed concert pitched as a conservative alternative to Bad Bunny’s main event at the Super Bowl on Sunday night.
item.dc:creator: Marc Tracy

media:content.media:description: Kid Rock at the Republican National Convention in 2024. He performed Sunday night in an alternative halftime show for Turning Point USA.

item.title: Lady Gaga, Ricky Martin and Cardi B Join Bad Bunny at Super Bowl Halftime Show
item.description: The Super Bowl headliner brought out stars to join the celebration.
item.dc:creator: James Wagner and Annie Correal

media:content.media:credit: Loren Elliott for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Lady Gaga performed a version of “Die With a Smile,” her hit duet with Bruno Mars.

item.title: Cómo Bad Bunny da voz a la ‘generación de la crisis’ de Puerto Rico
item.description: Los jóvenes puertorriqueños dicen que la estrella ha abierto los ojos del mundo a sus retos y a la tensa relación territorial de la isla con el gobierno estadounidense.
item.dc:creator: Patricia Mazzei and Laura N. Pérez Sánchez

media:content.media:credit: Erika P. Rodriguez for The New York Times

item.title: Previo al Super Bowl, Green Day arremetió contra el ICE
item.description: Billie Joe Armstrong instó a los agentes del ICE a dejar su trabajo, advirtiéndoles que el gobierno de Trump los abandonaría.
item.dc:creator: Derrick Bryson Taylor

media:content.media:description: Billie Joe Armstrong de Green Day en la presentación de la banda antes del saque inicial del Super Bowl el domingo

item.title: Japan Stocks Surge on Takaichi’s Landslide Election Win
item.description: Stocks climbed on Monday as investors cheered a result seen as a mandate for the prime minister’s high-spending economic agenda.
item.dc:creator: River Akira Davis

media:content.media:description: Sanae Takaichi is broadly viewed as a boon for corporate Japan because of her support for low interest rates and robust fiscal spending to stimulate growth.

item.title: Live Updates: Hong Kong Court Sentences Jimmy Lai to 20 Years
item.description: The media tycoon, a Chinese-born British citizen, had been a persistent critic of Beijing. The sentence is the harshest penalty so far under a national security law.
item.dc:creator: The New York Times

media:content.media:credit: Lam Yik Fei for The New York Times

item.title: Mack Hollins’s Red Jumpsuit and the Super Bowl Arrivals
item.description: The Super Bowl tunnel walk is the show before the show. Athletes arrived in head-to-toe monograms, shackles and leather.
item.dc:creator: Jacob Gallagher

media:content.media:description: New England Patriots wide receiver Mack Hollins wore a red jumpsuit with “Range 13” on the back, and his face covered.

item.title: Cold Deaths in New York Climb to 18 as Frigid Winds Linger
item.description: A person was found dead in the Bronx on Saturday morning, the police said. An 81-year-old man was also found dead on a rooftop, though it was unclear whether the cold was to blame.
item.dc:creator: Ashley Southall and William K. Rashbaum

media:content.media:credit: José A. Alvarado Jr. for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Extreme cold warnings remained in effect across much of the Northeast through Monday morning, including New York City, because of dangerously low wind chills.

item.title: Ilia Malinin's Quad Axel Positions Him as 2026 Olympics Gold Favorite
item.description: Ilia Malinin of the United States is the only figure skater to land a quadruple axel in competition. We break down why it’s so hard.
item.dc:creator: Weiyi Cai, Joe Ward, Jeremy White and Bedel Saget

item.title: Venezuela Frees Key Opposition Figures as Government Courts U.S. Support
item.description: Hours after the release of at least 35 political prisoners, the most prominent one was “kidnapped” by armed men, according to relatives.
item.dc:creator: Genevieve Glatsky
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

media:content.media:description: Juan Pablo Guanipa, center, a Venezuelan opposition politician, outside El Helicoide detention center in Caracas after his release on Sunday.

item.title: Fred Smith, Who Left Blondie for the Band Television, Dies at 77
item.description: In the ’70s, New York’s bohemia was devoted to hostile yet arty rock. Mr. Smith had two qualities rare in the scene: personal and musical understatement.
item.dc:creator: Alex Traub

media:content.media:description: Fred Smith performing with Television in 1977. He joined the band after leaving Blondie, which he said “was like a boat that was sinking.”

item.title: Bad Bunny Delivers Joyful Super Bowl Halftime Show
item.description: Lady Gaga and Ricky Martin joined the Puerto Rican musician in a show that celebrated Latino heritage and was performed mostly in Spanish. His appearance had become a political flashpoint amid his criticism of ICE.
item.dc:creator: The New York Times

media:content.media:credit: Loren Elliott for The New York Times

item.title: Here’s the latest.
item.dc:creator: Ben Sisario

item.title: La intérprete de lengua de señas de Bad Bunny también hará historia en el Super Bowl
item.description: El lenguaje de señas puertorriqueño no es el mismo que el lenguaje de signos estadounidense. Celimar Rivera Cosme captará de forma única la jerga del artista para los espectadores sordos.
item.dc:creator: Emmanuel Morgan

media:content.media:description: Celimar Rivera Cosme interpretó para Bad Bunny en su gira mundial en 2022 y su residencia de 31 espectáculos en San Juan el año pasado. El Super Bowl será, por mucho, su mayor escenario.

item.title: Green Day Condemns ICE as Part of Super Bowl Festivities
item.description: The band’s frontman, Billie Joe Armstrong, urged Immigration and Customs Enforcement agents to quit their jobs, warning that the Trump administration would inevitably abandon them.
item.dc:creator: Derrick Bryson Taylor

media:content.media:description: Billie Joe Armstrong of Green Day performing before the kickoff of the Super Bowl on Sunday.

item.title: NYT Crossword Answers for Feb. 9, 2026
item.description: Enjoy this savory puzzle from Matthew Stock.
item.dc:creator: Myq Kaplan

media:content.media:description: You can apply your crossword-solving skills to today’s puzzle.
